description: This file contains Bash shell functions for managing service registration and event handling using the sysEvent subsystem. It provides helper functions to register, unregister, and manage service events and their associated handlers, including asynchronous registration with various activation and tuple flags. The script also includes licensing information, helper functions for managing async IDs, and default event registration routines.

methods.name: sm_save_async
methods.description: Saves the async ID for a service and event into sysEvent variables for future reference and potential unregistration.

methods.name: sm_rm_event
methods.description: Removes the registered async handlers for a given service and event.

methods.name: sm_register_one_event
methods.description: Registers a single event-handler with optional activation and tuple flags, and stores the async ID.

methods.name: sm_register_for_default_events
methods.description: Registers a service for its standard start, stop, and restart events with a specified handler.

methods.name: sm_unregister
methods.description: Unregisters all events associated with a service, including default and custom events, and marks service status as stopped.

methods.name: sm_register
methods.description: Registers a service, its default event handlers, and any custom events, ensuring proper cleanup prior to registration.
